heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm fell at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour over the 144.8 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 34.3mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 09 November 2025, the storm lasted 144.8 hours with a total precipitation of 47.89mm and it reached 24.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 3 cold snaps, with an average of 3.6 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 0 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (216°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 128.2 mph from 27 January 2026.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.7°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.6 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 2928 lux) and rainfall (up 0.6 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.2 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 42.1m higher than yesterday, 44.3m lower than the past week, 58.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 557m to a maximum of 849m, averaging 713.7m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 757.9m and 771.9m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, the sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds, and overcast conditions will limit sunlight. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (96%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
